alert.note: Alert for Bollinger; Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 08 at 9:54PM CDT until May 09 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Bollinger County in southeastern Missouri... Northeastern Wayne County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 400 AM CDT Tuesday. * At 954 PM CDT, Radar indicaes between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen across northeastern Wayne and southern Bollinger County. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grassy, Cascade, Leopold and Zalma. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
